meanings.definition: resembling or characteristic of a fogy
meanings.sent1: The fogyish gentleman always wore a bow tie and carried a pocket watch.
meanings.sent2: Her fogyish taste in music leaned towards big band swing and ragtime.
meanings.sent3: Despite his fogyish ways, Grandpa could still bust a move on the dance floor.
meanings.sent4: The antique shop was filled with fogyish furniture that seemed to whisper stories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The fogyish aroma of old books and leather filled the cozy library.

meanings.definition: old-fashioned or outdated in attitude or style
meanings.sent1: The fogyish restaurant only played music from the 1950s and had checkered tablecloths.
meanings.sent2: Her fogyish beliefs about gender roles clashed with modern feminist ideas.
meanings.sent3: Wearing a fogyish top hat to school made him the center of attention.
meanings.sent4: The fogyish building stood out in the cityscape like a relic from another era.
meanings.sent5: The fogyish car chugged along the road, drawing curious looks from passersby.
